715046f-a.title: Manhattan: 112th Street - 1st Avenue
715046f-a.text:
A1:
112th Street,-east from and including First Avenue.
About 1925.
Ng ~ 99(

731628f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731628f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our fady of Mt. Carmel: Parade turning west at First
Avenue and 111th Street, N.W. corner.
The small building behind the fence is an old atable, now
belonging to the Consolidated Gas Compeny. The building
farther west on 111th Street is the JJefferson Park Building
of the Boys' Club, erected since 1V25.
July 16, 1931.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The parade, headed south, in front of 1071-1069 First Avenue,
west side, between 113th and 112th Streets. Two fine
candelabra, crowned with flowers, are shown.
July lo, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

720690f-a.title: Manhattan: 112th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
720690f-a.text:
Jofferson Park: The recreation pier on the East River
at the foot of East 112th Street, as viowed southward.
The park proper is to the right. About 1939-40, the
East River Drive will be constructed here and the pier
will disappear.
1933
George L. Balgue, photo

707709f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 112th St. E.
707709f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, at (what would be if continued) East 112th
Street, showing the avenue under repair. Fenced area shown is Jefferson
Park.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

731653f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731653f-b.text:
Masses of candles being carried by the marchers in the parade of the
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel. View 1 is at First Ave. and East 112th
Street, while 2 and 3 are at East 113th Street.
July 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

731615f-a.text:

Street, from Second Avenue.
July 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
